citation.article-title: Arenimonas oryziterrae sp. nov., isolated from a field of rice (Oryza sativa L.) managed under a no-tillage regime, and reclassification of Aspromonas composti as Arenimonas composti comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Arenimonas composti comb. nov.
Basonym: Aspromonas composti Jin et al. 2007.
The description is the same as that provided by Jin et al. (2007) for Aspromonas composti.
In addition, it can hydrolyse hippurate but not elastin.

The major fatty acid profile is similar to the previously published data except that small amounts of the cellular fatty acids iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C12 : 1 AT 11-12 and C10 : 0 are detected on R2A agar, but not on TSA.
